meanings.definition: A person or thing that totals.
meanings.sent1: The diligent totalizers in the office always make sure the numbers add up correctly.
meanings.sent2: The cashier used the totalizers to calculate the cost of the groceries.
meanings.sent3: The totalizers, also known as the math wizards, worked their magic on the budget.
meanings.sent4: Her brain was like a set of totalizers, constantly adding and subtracting information.
meanings.sent5: The totalizers hummed softly as they tallied up the expenses.

meanings.definition: A device used to calculate a total.
meanings.sent1: The electronic totalizers at the store quickly added up the prices of the items.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic relied on the totalizers to measure the engine's performance.
meanings.sent3: The totalizers beeped happily when the final amount was displayed.
meanings.sent4: The totalizers glowed in the dark workshop, illuminating the numbers.
meanings.sent5: With a click, the totalizers displayed the sum of all the parts.

meanings.sent1: The totalizers of the day were complete, and the final amount was ready.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the totalizers, finding satisfaction in adding everything up.
meanings.sent3: The totalizers seemed to dance as they added the numbers together.
meanings.sent4: The totalizers raced against the clock to finish the calculation before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The totalizers chugged along, steadily reaching the grand total.
